message:
WEEK 1 — Accumulation Phase Launch

Welcome to 6-day PPL training. You're hitting each muscle group 2x/week now. Start conservative (RPE 7-8) to establish your baseline—leave 2-3 reps in reserve. Track everything: weight, reps, RPE.

This Week:
- Mon: Push (chest/shoulders)
- Tue: Pull (back/biceps)
- Wed: Legs (quad emphasis)
- Thu: Push (triceps/front delts)
- Fri: Pull (rear delts/biceps)
- Sat: Legs (hamstring/glute)
- Sun: Rest/optional Zone 2

Intensity: RPE 7-8 (moderate load)
Volume: 12-14 sets per muscle group

Don't max out Week 1. Build volume tolerance over the next 6 weeks—that's how accumulation works.
qualityNotes: Emphasizes frequency increase (6 days, 2x per muscle)
Conservative start acknowledged (RPE 7-8, leave reps in reserve)
Explicit tracking instruction (weight, reps, RPE)
7-day PPL structure clearly outlined
Sets per muscle group specified (12-14)
Educates on accumulation phase concept
Confident tone appropriate for intermediate trainees

message:
WEEK 7 — Deload Week

Time to recover from 6 weeks of accumulation. Cut volume 50% (half your sets), reduce load to 70-80% of Week 6 weights, RPE 6-7 max. This is ACTIVE recovery—don't skip the gym, but don't push hard either.

This Week:
- Mon: Push (deload)
- Tue: Pull (deload)
- Wed: Legs (deload)
- Thu: Push (deload)
- Fri: Pull (deload)
- Sat: Legs (deload)
- Sun: Full rest (no cardio)

Intensity: RPE 6-7 (lighter loads)
Volume: 6-7 sets per muscle group

Deloads aren't breaks—they're when adaptation happens. Sleep 8-9 hours, eat at maintenance. You'll feel fresh by Week 8, ready for intensification phase.
qualityNotes: Clearly states deload parameters (50% volume, 70-80% loads)
Frames as 'active recovery' (not skipping gym)
All 6 training days marked as deload (consistency)
Sunday explicitly 'Full rest (no cardio)' for max recovery
Volume halved: 12-14 sets → 6-7 sets
Reframes potential guilt: 'Deloads aren't breaks—they're when adaptation happens'
Sleep/nutrition guidance maintained during deload
Forward-looking: prepares for intensification phase

message:
WEEK 13 — Peak Intensification

Hardest week of the program. RPE 8-9 across the board. Deploy advanced techniques: rest-pause on compounds (failure → 15sec rest → 2-3 more reps), drop sets on isolation (failure → reduce 30% → failure again), slow eccentrics (4-5sec) on accessories.

This Week:
- Mon: Push (rest-pause bench)
- Tue: Pull (rest-pause deadlift)
- Wed: Legs (rest-pause squat)
- Thu: Push (drop set laterals/pushdowns)
- Fri: Pull (drop set rear delts/curls)
- Sat: Legs (drop set RDL/leg curls)
- Sun: Full rest (8-9hr sleep non-negotiable)

Intensity: RPE 8-9 (heavy)
Volume: 14-16 sets per muscle group

This is where growth happens. Form is still king—don't sacrifice technique for reps. One more week, then final deload.
qualityNotes: Prepares trainee mentally ('Hardest week of the program')
Explicitly defines advanced techniques with execution details
Rest-pause: failure → 15sec rest → 2-3 more reps
Drop sets: failure → reduce 30% → failure again
Slow eccentrics: 4-5sec negatives
Each day notes which technique is featured (rest-pause Monday/Tuesday/Wednesday, drop sets Thursday/Friday/Saturday)
Sunday emphasizes critical recovery (8-9hr sleep)
Volume maintained/slightly increased: 14-16 sets (vs 12-14 in accumulation)
Safety reminder: 'Form is still king'
Context: 'One more week, then final deload' (end in sight)
